alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 25 at 3:58AM EDT until March 25 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT FOR WESTERN CHEROKEE...EASTERN POLK AND SOUTHERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 357 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles west of Town Of Santeetlah, or 17 miles west of Robbinsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ducktown, Tellico Plains, William L. Davenport Refuge, Coker Creek, Violet, Tariffville, Big Frog Mountain, Turtletown, Copperhill and Hiawasse Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
